name: Pulumi
help: Pulumi is an open source infrastructure as code tool for creating, deploying and managing cloud infrastructure. Pulumi works with traditional infrastructure like VMs, networks, and databases, in addition to modern architectures, including containers, Kubernetes clusters, and serverless functions. Pulumi supports dozens of public, private, and hybrid cloud service providers.

properties.name: Config
properties.help: Config to use during the update.

properties.name: ConfigFile
properties.help: Use the configuration values in the specified file rather than detecting the file name.

properties.name: ConfigPath
properties.help: Config keys contain a path to a property in a map or list to set.

properties.name: Debug
properties.help: Print detailed debugging output during resource operations.

properties.name: Diff
properties.help: Display operation as a rich diff showing the overall change.

properties.name: ExpectNoChanges
properties.help: Return an error if any changes occur during this update.

properties.name: Message
properties.help: Optional message to associate with the update operation.

properties.name: Parallel
properties.help: Allow P resource operations to run in parallel at once (1 for no parallelism). Defaults to unbounded. (default <c>2147483647</c>).

properties.name: PolicyPack
properties.help: Run one or more policy packs as part of this update.

properties.name: PolicyPackConfig
properties.help: Path to JSON file containing the config for the policy pack of the corresponding <c>--policy-pack</c> flag.

properties.name: Refresh
properties.help: Refresh the state of the stack's resources before this update.

properties.name: Replace
properties.help: Specify resources to replace. Multiple resources can be specified using <c>--replace urn1 --replace urn2</c>.

properties.name: SecretsProvider
properties.help: The type of the provider that should be used to encrypt and decrypt secrets (possible choices: <c>default</c>, <c>passphrase</c>, <c>awskms</c>, <c>azurekeyvault</c>, <c>gcpkms</c>, <c>hashivault</c>). Only used when creating a new stack from an existing template (default <c>default</c>).

properties.name: ShowConfig
properties.help: Show configuration keys and variables.

properties.name: ShowReads
properties.help: Show resources that are being read in, alongside those being managed directly in the stack.

properties.name: ShowReplacementSteps
properties.help: Show detailed resource replacement creates and deletes instead of a single step.

properties.name: ShowSames
properties.help: Show resources that don't need be updated because they haven't changed, alongside those that do.

properties.name: SkipPreview
properties.help: Do not perform a preview before performing the update.

properties.name: Stack
properties.help: The name of the stack to operate on. Defaults to the current stack.

properties.name: SuppressOutputs
properties.help: Suppress display of stack outputs (in case they contain sensitive values).

properties.name: SuppressPermalink
properties.help: Suppress display of the state permalink.

properties.name: Target
properties.help: Specify a single resource URN to update. Other resources will not be updated. Multiple resources can be specified using <c>--target urn1 --target urn2</c>.

properties.name: TargetDependents
properties.help: Allows updating of dependent targets discovered but not specified in <c>--target</c> list.

properties.name: TargetReplace
properties.help: Specify a single resource URN to replace. Other resources will not be updated. Shorthand for <c>--target urn --replace urn</c>.

properties.name: Yes
properties.help: Automatically approve and perform the update after previewing it.

properties.name: ShowSecrets
properties.help: Show secret values when listing config instead of displaying blinded values.

properties.name: Stack
properties.help: The name of the stack to operate on. Defaults to the current stack.

properties.name: Destination
properties.help: The name of the new stack to copy the config to.

properties.name: Path
properties.help: The key contains a path to a property in a map or list to set.

properties.name: Key
properties.help: The key to the key-value pair in the configuration.

properties.name: Json
properties.help: Serialize the preview diffs, operations, and overall output as JSON.

properties.name: Path
properties.help: The key contains a path to a property in a map or list to set.

properties.name: Force
properties.help: Overwrite configuration file, if it exists, without creating a backup.

properties.name: Key
properties.help: The key to the key-value pair in the configuration.

properties.name: Path
properties.help: The key contains a path to a property in a map or list to set.

properties.name: Key
properties.help: The key to the key-value pair in the configuration.

properties.name: Value
properties.help: The new value for specified configuration key.

properties.name: Path
properties.help: The key contains a path to a property in a map or list to set.

properties.name: Plaintext
properties.help: Save the value as plaintext (unencrypted).

properties.name: Secret
properties.help: Encrypt the value instead of storing it in plaintext.

properties.name: ShowIds
properties.help: Display each resource's provider-assigned unique ID.

properties.name: ShowName
properties.help: Display only the stack name.

properties.name: ShowSecrets
properties.help: Display stack outputs which are marked as secret in plaintext.

properties.name: ShowUrns
properties.help: Display each resource's Pulumi-assigned globally unique URN.

properties.name: Stack
properties.help: The name of the stack to operate on. Defaults to the current stack.

properties.name: NewSecretsProvider
properties.help: The name of the new secrets provider.

properties.name: File
properties.help: A filename to write stack output to.

properties.name: ShowSecrets
properties.help: Display stack outputs which are marked as secret in plaintext.

properties.name: Version
properties.help: Previous stack version to export. (If unset, will export the latest.).

properties.name: File
properties.help: A file that will have a Graphviz DOT graph written to it.

properties.name: DependencyEdgeColor
properties.help: Sets the color of dependency edges in the graph (default <c>#246C60</c>).

properties.name: IgnoreDependencyEdges
properties.help: Ignores edges introduced by dependency resource relationships.

properties.name: IgnoreParentEdges
properties.help: Ignores edges introduced by parent/child resource relationships.

properties.name: ParentEdgeColor
properties.help: Sets the color of parent edges in the graph (default <c>#AA6639</c>).

properties.name: Json
properties.help: Serialize the preview diffs, operations, and overall output as JSON.

properties.name: ShowSecrets
properties.help: Show secret values when listing config instead of displaying blinded values.

properties.name: File
properties.help: A filename to read stack input from.

properties.name: Force
properties.help: Force the import to occur, even if apparent errors are discovered beforehand (not recommended).

properties.name: OrganizationAndName
properties.help: The stack name, optionally preceded by the organization name and a slash: <c>[<org-name>/]<stack-name></c>

properties.name: CopyConfigFrom
properties.help: The name of the stack to copy existing config from.

properties.name: SecretsProvider
properties.help: The type of the provider that should be used to encrypt and decrypt secrets (possible choices: <c>default</c>, <c>passphrase</c>, <c>awskms</c>, <c>azurekeyvault</c>, <c>gcpkms</c>, <c>hashivault</c>) (default <c>default</c>).

properties.name: All
properties.help: List all stacks instead of just stacks for the current project.

properties.name: Json
properties.help: Emit output as JSON.

properties.name: Organization
properties.help: Filter returned stacks to those in a specific organization.

properties.name: Project
properties.help: Filter returned stacks to those with a specific project name.

properties.name: Tag
properties.help: Filter returned stacks to those in a specific tag (<c>tag-name</c> or <c>tag-name=tag-value</c>).

properties.name: PropertyName
properties.help: The name of the property whose output value should be listed. This is optional.

properties.name: Json
properties.help: Emit output as JSON.

properties.name: ShowSecrets
properties.help: Display outputs which are marked as secret in plaintext.

properties.name: NewStackName
properties.help: The new name for the stack.

properties.name: StackName
properties.help: The name for the stack to be removed.

properties.name: Force
properties.help: Forces deletion of the stack, leaving behind any resources managed by the stack.

properties.name: PreserveConfig
properties.help: Do not delete the corresponding Pulumi.<stack-name>.yaml configuration file for the stack.

properties.name: Yes
properties.help: Skip confirmation prompts, and proceed with removal anyway.

properties.name: StackName
properties.help: The name of the stack that should be selected.

properties.name: Create
properties.help: If selected stack does not exist, create it.

properties.name: SecretsProvider
properties.help: Use with <c>--create</c> flag, The type of the provider that should be used to encrypt and decrypt secrets (possible choices: <c>default</c>, <c>passphrase</c>, <c>awskms</c>, <c>azurekeyvault</c>, <c>gcpkms</c>, <c>hashivault</c>) (default <c>default</c>).

properties.name: Name
properties.help: The name of the tag to be set.

properties.name: Value
properties.help: The value of the tag to be set.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: The name of the tag to be set.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: The name of the tag to be set.

properties.name: Json
properties.help: Emit output as JSON.

properties.name: Template
properties.help: The template or URL to base the new stack off of.

properties.name: Config
properties.help: Config to save.

properties.name: ConfigPath
properties.help: Config keys contain a path to a property in a map or list to set.

properties.name: Description
properties.help: The project description; if not specified, a prompt will request it.

properties.name: Directory
properties.help: The location to place the generated project; if not specified, the current directory is used.

properties.name: Force
properties.help: Forces content to be generated even if it would change existing files.

properties.name: GenerateOnly
properties.help: Generate the project only; do not create a stack, save config, or install dependencies.

properties.name: Name
properties.help: The project name; if not specified, a prompt will request it.

properties.name: Offline
properties.help: Use locally cached templates without making any network requests.

properties.name: SecretsProvider
properties.help: The type of the provider that should be used to encrypt and decrypt secrets (possible choices: <c>default</c>, <c>passphrase</c>, <c>awskms</c>, <c>azurekeyvault</c>, <c>gcpkms</c>, <c>hashivault</c>) (default <c>default</c>).

properties.name: Stack
properties.help: The stack name; either an existing stack or stack to create; if not specified, a prompt will request it.

properties.name: Yes
properties.help: Skip prompts and proceed with default values.

properties.name: ConfigFile
properties.help: Use the configuration values in the specified file rather than detecting the file name.

properties.name: Debug
properties.help: Print detailed debugging output during resource operations.

properties.name: Diff
properties.help: Display operation as a rich diff showing the overall change.

properties.name: Message
properties.help: Optional message to associate with the destroy operation.

properties.name: Parallel
properties.help: Allow P resource operations to run in parallel at once (1 for no parallelism). Defaults to unbounded. (default <c>2147483647</c>).

properties.name: Refresh
properties.help: Refresh the state of the stack's resources before this update.

properties.name: ShowConfig
properties.help: Show configuration keys and variables.

properties.name: ShowReplacementSteps
properties.help: Show detailed resource replacement creates and deletes instead of a single step.

properties.name: ShowSames
properties.help: Show resources that don't need to be updated because they haven't changed, alongside those that do.

properties.name: SkipPreview
properties.help: Do not perform a preview before performing the destroy.

properties.name: Stack
properties.help: The stack name; either an existing stack or stack to create; if not specified, a prompt will request it.

properties.name: SuppressOutputs
properties.help: Suppress display of stack outputs (in case they contain sensitive values).

properties.name: SuppressPermalink
properties.help: Suppress display of the state permalink.

properties.name: Target
properties.help: Specify a single resource URN to destroy. All resources necessary to destroy this target will also be destroyed. Multiple resources can be specified using: <c>--target urn1 --target urn2</c>.

properties.name: TargetDependents
properties.help: Allows destroying of dependent targets discovered but not specified in <c>--target</c> list.

properties.name: Yes
properties.help: Automatically approve and perform the destroy after previewing it.

commonTaskProperties.name: Color
commonTaskProperties.help: Colorize output. Choices are: always, never, raw, auto (default <c>auto</c>).

commonTaskProperties.name: Cwd
commonTaskProperties.help: Run pulumi as if it had been started in another directory.

commonTaskProperties.name: DisableIntegrityChecking
commonTaskProperties.help: Disable integrity checking of checkpoint files.

commonTaskProperties.name: LogFlow
commonTaskProperties.help: Flow log settings to child processes (like plugins).

commonTaskProperties.name: LogToStderr
commonTaskProperties.help: Log to stderr instead of to files.

commonTaskProperties.name: NonInteractive
commonTaskProperties.help: Disable interactive mode for all commands.

commonTaskProperties.name: Profiling
commonTaskProperties.help: Emit CPU and memory profiles and an execution trace to <c>[filename].[pid].{cpu,mem,trace}</c>, respectively.

commonTaskProperties.name: Tracing
commonTaskProperties.help: Emit tracing to the specified endpoint. Use the file: scheme to write tracing data to a local file.

commonTaskProperties.name: Verbose
commonTaskProperties.help: Enable verbose logging (e.g., <c>v=3</c>); anything >3 is very verbose.
